page.title: 06BISHOPSBOURNE SOCIAL LIFE
page.content: Despite its small population, the community has an active social life with dances, discos, coffee mornings, jumbles sales and other fund-raising events. There are several clubs: Youth Club, Drama Group, Football, Cricket, and a Horticultural Society which arr- anges talks, film shows, outings and an annual Flower Show. However, these groups could not flourish without add- itional support from other villages. One popular annual event is the Sheep Dog Trials which attracts competition from all over the country. Stalls and sideshows, which raise money for the church, are added attractons. There is a football field, a cricket pitch and a recreation ground for the children. The Village Hall, known as The Conrad Hall, was named after Joseph Conrad (1857-1924) who spent his last years at "Oswalds", a house by the church.
